title: does anyone have a swedish identity (three crowns)
content:
Simple, does anyone have swedish national logo - three crowns, in vector format of course.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107232345im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logoTop_5644.gif)
author: garden

comments.content:
It isn't there sadly :(

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
-  
golden ratio of passion. sansogno.coastaldisturbance.com

There are several different versions of these crowns, varying in complexity.

For example,

[http://www.sweden.se/templates/cs/FactSheet\_\_\_\_14193.aspx](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107232345/http:/www.sweden.se/templates/cs/FactSheet ____ 14193.aspx "http://www.sweden.se/templates/cs/FactSheet\_\_\_\_14193.aspx")

[http://www.ngw.nl/int/zwe/se-nat.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107232345/http:/www.ngw.nl/int/zwe/se-nat.htm "http://www.ngw.nl/int/zwe/se-nat.htm")

For vector try [www.brandsoftheworld.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107232345/http:/www.brandsoftheworld.com/ "www.brandsoftheworld.com") and search on say 'Sweden Hockey', 'Swedish Olympic Committee'.

See also

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coat\_of\_arms\_of\_Sweden](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107232345/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coat_of_arms_of_Sweden "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coat\_of\_arms\_of\_Sweden")

and note section on regulated use.

Here's a pdf with it on:  
 [http://www.sweden.se/upload/Sweden\_se/english/factsheets/SI/SI\_FS38a\_Swe...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107232345/http:/www.sweden.se/upload/Sweden_se/english/factsheets/SI/SI_FS38a_Swedish_education/Swedish_education_FS38a.pdf "http://www.sweden.se/upload/Sweden\_se/english/factsheets/SI/SI\_FS38a\_Swedish\_education/Swedish\_education\_FS38a.pdf")
If you decide to redraw it, I reckon each crown is a 4x3. The lower vertices then appear to fall at the golden section. The whole thing (ie all 3 crowns) fit onto a 12x8 rectangle.

Redrawing it would be unnecessary, since you posted a PDF. You can open that PDF in Illustrator, and copy the logo in vectors from it.

Because I'm so nice, I have done just that. Shall I upload it somewhere?  
Or if you want to do it yourself.. :)

edit:  
Though I'm not sure if such a thing is allowed, reading that regulations and such.

Nick job wrote: See also
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coat_of_arms_of_Sweden
and note section on regulated use. You should look this over, the use of the coat of arms is heavily regulated.
I think Saab used three crowns as part of their logo at some point in their history. Not sure about right now.
